Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2011 09:14AM tacichon wrote: Bedo, I start my rads too, lets do it together and stay positive!! I go for my dry run on Tuesday and get my schedule.  I have to drive 18 miles 1 way for my rads.. and then I will be doing my job out of my house. What I understand is to keep busy, but when you are tired take a nap. Bedo you and I can do it, I am going to do it and get it over with!!! Come girl let's go and get it over with. Everyone on this site it so helpful and supportive I don't know what I would do without all these amazing women!! Everyone keep fighting!! Hugs and Blessings to all! Terri

Posts.Content: tacichon wrote: I had 3 lumpectomies for DCIS in my right breast. I had my radiation consultation yesterday and I have a CTC schedule for Tuesday. What exactly is a CTC? what will it show and I am scared to death it will  show something else wrong with me. I am fortunate with the 3 lumpectomies that I had allot to give and you cannot tell any difference in the size of my breast Hugs and blessings, Terri. Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2011 06:19PM tacichon wrote: I had my CTC, but I should have called it a CTS, that is when they put me in the radiation machine  and do  imaging of my breast and set the markers!! Ready. set, Go! I start my rads next Thursday 9/15/11 everyday at 2:20 for 6 weeks! I am getting ready for the challenge, but I will beat this cancer!! 10/27/11 is my magic date, the day I hope my rads end!! Everyone keep fighting! Hugs and blessings to all you amazing women!! Terri
